page.title: 16A FARM VISIT TO GWAUN VALLEY
page.content: A group of children visited a typical farm in the area.It was some 50 acres. The farmhouse was built some 120 years ago and its visual appereance had not changed a great deal.Our first impressions were that the farm seemed to be behind the times,very few signs of modern buildings. We were greeted by the farmer's wife who showed us around the milking parlour.The building which had been built the same time as the farm had been modernised to accept 6 cows for milking.Although this was an improvement it was a long way short of the mechanised farm processes used in other area.The improvement made had been very gradual over many years.When one of the children asked what a milk churn in the corner was the farmers wife suddenly realised that things had changed quite a bit from the time that
